body_html:
@soumith , I don't think all zeros/nan samples can produce this problem since I use clip gradient when training the model. The learned parameters will not be updated too much each time.
Moreover, the training phase looks good and the model works well if I replace net.eval() with net.train().
body_text:
@soumith , I don't think all zeros/nan samples can produce this problem since I use clip gradient when training the model. The learned parameters will not be updated too much each time.
Moreover, the training phase looks good and the model works well if I replace net.eval() with net.train().
body:
@soumith , I don't think all zeros/nan samples can produce this problem since I use clip gradient when training the model. The learned parameters will not be updated too much each time.
Moreover, the training phase looks good and the model works well if I replace net.eval() with net.train().
